de.eckhartarnold.client
Class ImageCollectionReader 

java.lang.Object
  de.eckhartarnold.client.ImageCollectionReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageCollectionInfo 
public class ImageCollectionReader
				
extends java.lang.Object
				
implements ImageCollectionInfo

Reads the information about the image collection from a number of .json files.

When the information is ready it can be queried with the getCaptions , getDirectories , getImageNames , getImageSizes , getInfo methods. The information on the image collection must contained in five files with the following hard coded names:

  1. "directories.json" - a list of directories
  2. "filenames.json" - a list of image file names
  3. "captions.json" - a dictionary that associates the image file names with the captions of the images
  4. "resolutions.json" - Either a list with two dictionaries, where the defines a certain number "resolution sets" (i.e. lists of image sizes that are associated with a name, e.g. "landscape" or "portrait") and the second associates each image name with the key of a resolution set or a dictionary that associates the image file names directly with list of image sizes, each size entry corresponding to one directory and consisting itself of a two entry list containing the width and height of the image in the respective directory.
  5. "info.json" - a dictionary with arbitrary additional information on the image collection. It should (but need not) contain at least the fields: "title", "subtitle" and "bottom line"

Author:
ecki

          This is a helper class that allows displaying an error message in a dialog so that the user can be notified of any error that occurred during reading the configuration data from the .json files.

Field Detail

METANAME_INFO

public static final java.lang.String METANAME_INFO
The name of the html meta-tag that contains an alternative file name for file "info.json". This meta-tag allows to switch the info.json, file that control the appearance of the photo album, from within the the html page that contains the photo album script.

Constructor Detail

ImageCollectionReader

public ImageCollectionReader(java.lang.String baseURL,
                             ImageCollectionReader.ICallback readyReport,
                             ImageCollectionReader.IMessage errorReport)
Reads the information about the image collection from several json files contained in the baseURL directory. When the json files have finished loading readyReport is issued. If any error occurs it is reported via errorReport . For error reporting the class ImageCollectionInfo offers two stock objects: ERROR_DIALOG and ERROR_SILET , the first of which reports the error in a pop up dialog, while the other simply ignores the error (dangerous!).

Parameters:
baseURL - the base URL of the image collection
readyReport - the callback that is to be issued when loading the information about the image collection is ready.
errorReport - the callback for reporting errors.
Method Detail

getCaptions

public java.lang.String[] getCaptions()
Description copied from interface: ImageCollectionInfo
Returns the array of caption string for the images. The order of the array corresponds to that of the images, i.e. the first entry of the caption array contains the caption of the first image etc. If an image does not have a caption the array contains an empty String.

Specified by:
getCaptions in interface ImageCollectionInfo
Returns:
the array of caption strings

getDirectories

public java.lang.String[] getDirectories()
Description copied from interface: ImageCollectionInfo
Returns a list of directory names. Each directory is to contain all the images scaled to a specific size class. The directory names contain the "full" path starting with the base URL that is passed to the ImageCollectionInfo constructor.

Specified by:
getDirectories in interface ImageCollectionInfo
Returns:
the directory names

getImageNames

public java.lang.String[] getImageNames()
Description copied from interface: ImageCollectionInfo
Returns the list of image filenames. The filenames do not contain any path information. A file with the same name, e.g. "beautiful_image.jpg" should be contained in every (sub-)directory for different image sizes.

Specified by:
getImageNames in interface ImageCollectionInfo
Returns:
the list of image filenames.

getImageSizes

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,int[][]> getImageSizes()
Description copied from interface: ImageCollectionInfo
Returns a dictionary that maps the image file names to their exact sizes. The sizes are pairs of integer values {x,y} and the length and order of the sizes tuple should correspond to the list of directories.

Specified by:
getImageSizes in interface ImageCollectionInfo
Returns:
the exact sizes of every image.

getInfo

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getInfo()
Description copied from interface: ImageCollectionInfo
Returns a dictionary of information strings. The dictionary may (but does not have to) contain such entries as "title", "subtitle" "bottom line" and any other arbitrary entry. The returned dictionary may be empty. Gallery objects use the information that is provided under the keys: "title", "subtitle", "bottom line".

Specified by:
getInfo in interface ImageCollectionInfo
Returns:
a dictionary with (arbitrary) information on the image collection

hasCaptions

public boolean hasCaptions()
Description copied from interface: ImageCollectionInfo
Returns true, if at least one image has a caption that is not empty.

Specified by:
hasCaptions in interface ImageCollectionInfo
Returns:
true, if there are captions

isReady

public boolean isReady()
Returns true, if loading the information about the image collection has finished and it is ready to be queried.

Returns:
true, if the information about the image collection is ready
